Question
========

It examines how many people would answer yes when asked whether they ever feel depressed. The percentage who answered with "yes. answers is 33% from a sample of 350 randomly asked people. The researchers want to know if the percentage exceeds 30%. To that end they set the null hypothesis at H~0~: *p*~0~ = 30%. From what percentage can the null hypothesis be rejected when a significance level is used of 2.5%?

Answerlist
----------

* 25%
* 30%
* 35%

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 25%: Incorrect
* 30%: Incorrect
* 35%: Correct
